name: Lamps and Candles

pages.name: Lamps
pages.text: Lamps are a long term source of light. They burn liquid fuel.
Using a bucket, $(item)$(k:key.use)$() on a lamp to add fuel to it. It can then be lit with a $(item)firestarter$() or anything capable of lighting fires. Lamps retain their fuel content when broken.
One lamp fuel is $(thing)olive oil$(). The first step in its production is to make olive paste.
You will also need a jute net.

Seal the $(item)olive paste$() with $(item)water$() in a $(l:mechanics/barrels)Barrel$() to make $(thing)olive oil water$(). Seal that in with your $(item)jute net$() to produce $(thing)olive oil$(). Olive oil burns for 8 in-game hours for every unit of fluid.
Another lamp fuel is $(thing)tallow$(). To make it, cook 5 $(item)blubber$(), in a $(l:mechanics/pot)Pot$() of water. Tallow burns for less than 2 in-game hours per unit.

pages.name: Candles
pages.text: The candle is made from sealing $(item)string$() in a bucket of $(thing)tallow$().

pages.name: Lava Lamps
pages.text: Lava will keep burning forever, but can only be held in a $(thing)blue steel$() lamp.
$(item)Chains$() are a great way to hang your lamps, and can be smithed in an $(l:mechanics/anvils)Anvil$().
